title: People & Relationships
objectives: Combine topics with 은/는 and subjects with 이/가
context: Talking about family, friends, and coworkers is everyday conversation.
Possessive 제/제 친구 adds warmth and clarity when introducing people.
Particles help mark who we're talking about and who is acting.
explanation: 제 is the polite 'my' (from 저 + 의). Use 내 for casual. 제 친구, 제 부모님 are safer than 내 with new people.
당신 is rarely used in conversation except between spouses or in customer service. Use 이름+씨 (e.g., 민수 씨) to say 'you.'
은/는 sets the topic (제 친구는...), 이/가 marks the subject (동료가...). Both can appear in one sentence if needed.
For respect toward elders/parents, use honorific verbs like 계시다 (to be/exist honorifically) instead of 있다: 부모님이 계세요.
To introduce someone: 이쪽은 제 친구 민수예요 = This is my friend Minsu.
